In the UK, the best time to plant potatoes is typically in late March to early April, when the soil has warmed up enough for the seed potatoes to start growing, and the risk of frost has passed. This timing will give the seed potatoes the longest possible growing season before the weather starts to get too hot.

The specific planting date will depend on your local climate and weather conditions. It's a good idea to check with your local nursery or gardening store for more information on the best planting time in your area.

You can also prepare the soil in advance by adding compost or well-rotted manure, and by chitting your seed potatoes (allowing them to sprout) 2-4 weeks before planting. This will help the seed potatoes to get a head start on the growing season.
